oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hank Thompson Show 1947-08-29
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Multiple recordings of the Hank Thompson Radio Show promoted by the Hamilton Furniture Company. Original recording was recorded on August 29, 1947 and broadcast September 01, 1947. Backed by his Brazos Valley Boys of Covie Jones, June, Smudgy, and Spud. Second half of the recording is of Hank Thompson and his Brazos Valley Boys and Tex Ritter performing on the Hank Thompson Show on an unknown date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Thompson; Tex Ritter
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Opening announcements performed by Robert Charles -- (00:09) Brazos Valley Rancho (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (00:31) [Unidentified tune, either: Here Today, Gone Tomorrow or Sweetheart for a Day] (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (02:30) Charles performs a Hamilton Furniture Company commercial break -- (03:27) Along the Trail to Dripping Springs (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (06:23) Charles performs a Hamilton Furniture Company commercial break -- (07:14) Whoa, Sailor (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (09:01) Charles performs a Hamilton Furniture Company commercial break -- (09:43) I'll Hold You in My Heart (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (11:32) Rock in the Ocean (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (13:01) Stay All Night (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (13:56) Charles closing statements -- (14:18) Brazos Valley Rancho (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (14:45) Opening for the Tex Ritter Show excerpt [poor quality] -- (15:18) Thompson introduces Tex Ritter -- (16:01) Darling, What More Can I Do? (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (18:45) Ritter introduces the band including: Covie Jones, June, Smudgy, and Spud -- (19:46) No One to Cry to (Covie Jones) -- (21:23) Long Time Gone (Tex Ritter) -- (23:21) Green Grow the Lilacs (Tex Ritter) -- (25:02) Ritter gives personal appearance schedule -- (27:34) Two Different Worlds (Tex Ritter) -- (30:05) Thompson closing statements -- (30:48) Brazos Valley Rancho [featuring Charles voiceover] (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys)
